thread.title: More donkeys allegedly skinned alive found
thread.title_full: More donkeys allegedly skinned alive found | News24

author: news24.com
title: More donkeys allegedly skinned alive found
text:
Pietermaritzburg - More dead donkeys thought to have been skinned alive have been found near the Lesotho border in Twin Springs, following the 18 that were found last Thursday.
The number of donkeys that were thought to have been skinned alive, allegedly for the Chinese medicinal market, has risen from 18 to 35. National Council of SPCAs (NSPCA) farm unit inspector Nazareth Appalsamy said several more donkeys had been found in “close proximity” to the 18 found on Thursday, in different areas.
Weekend Witness reported that it was suspected that 100 donkeys were found in a kraal on a plot of land eight kilometres from the border between KZN and Lesotho in the Twin Springs area.
Just outside the kraal lay 18 dead donkeys that are suspected to have been skinned alive.
